content.description: Climbs thin crack and edges, then traverse right under roof to join Clean Slate finish.
content.location: Orange face left of Clean slate

content.description: Good moves on big holds, crux at top.  Great sport warm up.
content.protection: bolts to anchor with biners (please leave them there!)
content.location: Thirty feet left of Miner League and just right of Mr Slate on the north east facing small face

content.description: A thin crack in a small left facing corner that diagonals left at the top to a chain anchor, or continue up to share Miner League anchor 5.8+.Good rock up top but a bit of loose stuff on the ledge midway.
content.location: #26 from the right. 20ft left of Dirty Low Down

content.description: Hand crack in dark rock. Loose block at top.
content.protection: Cams.  Two bolt anchor without chain or quicklinks. May traverse and lower off Deep Purple to climbers left.
content.location: Just left of Strike It Rich

content.description: Loose start to gain crack to nice slab.
content.protection: Gear in crack to three or less bolts on face with two bolt anchor under roof.
content.location: Crack starts 5ft. to right of 15ft. high detached block.

content.description: Fun climbing up good rock with a crux at the start and on top.
content.protection:
4 bolts, chain anchor 

Jay Foley first ascent "Strike it Rich" at Miner's.
content.location: middle of pillar left of Amalgamation

climbs.name: Reclamation
climbs.fa: Thor Husted, J. Foley, M. Howard

content.description:
Thin crack and edge climbing lead you to a pull over a large chalk stone.  Finish in a left facing corner. 

Thor Husted climbing Reclamation for the first ascent.
content.location: 10ft left of Ah-Ah Arete. Starts in small right facing corner.

content.description: One bolt gets you started in a hollow sounding crack that leads up to the clean headwall and harder climbing above
content.location: #15 from the right, left of small pillar and right of Miner Delay. We are also working the big chalked roof left of this route.

content.description: Power and balance up small holds and arete slapping to a rest on the arete. Finish up steeper rock with long moves on good holds. Expect a crux in the beginning and end!
content.location: Start up left side of steep blunt jet black arete that finishes up a bulge. Just left around the corner of Use Your Words and immediately right of Barney Rubble.

content.description: Face climbing left of and shares anchor with route #26.
Start on small edges and use these to reach a few sidepulls. Go up the bulge on bigger holds and gain the anchors at a good stance.
content.location: The route starts left of a loose crack, about 5ft. to the left of barney rubble (A bolted 5.11 on black rock to a jet black bulge). The route has a broken stump near the base and a 5.8+ crack to the left.

climbs.name: Miner's Lung
climbs.fa: Joel Tinl, J Foley, Thor Husted

content.description: Climbs black face left of arete a bit crimpy and contrived but  great rock. The arete can be toproped at an easier grade.
content.location: Start right of orange corner crack up beautiful black arete and face above.

content.description: Nice finger crack. Please do not climb on or touch rock art
content.location: finger crack splits clean brown face

climbs.name: Miner Threat
climbs.fa: J.Foley, T. Naylor, Dave, Mike and Joel, et all

content.description:
Sustained steep climbing on perfect rock with flat edges and an exciting finish. Shares anchor with Jawbone 5.9-  

minor threat
content.location: On the orange face immediately left of open book crack that is Jawbone. Starts right of small left-facing corner that protrudes from the bottom of this face.

climbs.name: Miner League
climbs.fa: Tim Naylor, Jay Foley, Justin J.

content.description: A tricky start leads to fun moves onto sloping ledge, then up a pocketed slab.
content.location: 5ft to right of tailings pile crack.  Black blunt arete to tan slab. Towards middle of crag.

content.description: Some loose rock down low leads to a wide hand crack up a steep face.
content.location: start behind a boulder on a south facing pile

content.description: Nice crimps to the fourth bolt. Then a funky ledge midway gets you to a clean steep headwall with some sustained crux climbing above.
content.location: Start in the middle of the small buttress left of Deep Purple

content.description: Long and pumpy. Very fingery with several cruxes. Middle loose section is 5.5ish with lots of bolts that need long runners. 5 two foot runners I think.  Stay off arete and right of bolts in loose middle. Over bolted due to pocketed rock and loose middle. Great 5.11 to work with good moves and sinker pockets.
content.protection: Bring sixteen clips, five of which should be 2ft. runners. Unclip 5th draw after clipping right chain of Mother anchors. Stay on face and go up left side of crack and right of bolts in loose easy middle.
content.location: Down river of Use Your Words and Barney Rubble.  The extension of Mother. Lower off with 60 meter cord.

content.description: Steep easy steming up orange rock riddled with edges finishes with a crux on smoother rock up a slitter corner crack.
content.location: 90 feet left of the Mr.Slate area in an open book corner right of bolted route Miner Threat and the furthest right route in this section of climbs which are located an the far left end of the crag before the massive bird poo pile..

content.description:
Steep finger crack with a rest midway 

Thor Husted on Hippie Crack 5.10-
content.location: Splits the big face left of Gold Pan Face

content.description: Steep climbing on small holds. Shares anchor with Hippie Crack.
content.location: 10' left of Hippie Crack

content.description: Nice moves on good rock with a sloping mantel finish.
content.location: The left most of three bolted routes up brown face, that starts low angle and gets steeper at the top.

content.description:
Easy climbing up to a tricky crux followed by a big crux move off a crimp to the jugs. A letter grade harder if you continue left and finish at Gold Pan anchor. 

Steve Laycock leading Gold Flake Arete 5.11.  Photo by Jay Foley
content.location: The right most route on a brown face with three bolted routes

content.description: A steep, blocky, right angling crack.
content.location: 75 feet left of Miners Lung. Start in middle of white face below large roof. Anchors hidden below roof.

content.description: Starts in poor quality rock up to better rock and crack in right facing corner. Crux at top. Shares anchor with Core Sample.
content.location: Corner left of Core Sample

content.description: Technical face climbing
content.location: Climb the Face Between Blood Diamond and Black Diamond

content.description: The first half of this route climbs up mediocre 5.11 edges. Some hollow rock in the middle gives up a rest and gets you to the headwall.  The headwall section has big pumpy moves with some big holds on steep bullet rock.  Pumpy dynamic and FUN! For full grade value traverse left to second anchor slightly higher and left.
content.location: Start about 20 ft left of reclamation on a 10ft wide buttress leading to a ledge 15 ft up. Look for a lightning bolt crack variation to the lower section  on the right.

climbs.name: Deep Purple
climbs.fa: Mike Howard with Joel Tinl & J. Foley

content.description: Crux is halfway. Pull over hollow block roof.
content.protection: Standard rack up to 4".  "Purple" BD Camalot fits "deep" below final roof crux.
content.location: Starts 10' left of Tin Cup. Climb wide crack and face up to small roof.

content.description: A wide crack hidden in corner on good rock. Shares anchor with Gold Pan
content.location: left edge of brown face with 3 bolted routes

content.description: Technical, crimpy moves up to arete with better holds. Rest halfway. Pumpy finish.
content.location: Follows a thin seam up arete located behind a big cactus and just left of Hippie routes. Shares anchor with corner crack to the left.

climbs.name: Contributing to the Delinquency of a Miner

content.description: A bit of loose rock midway gives way to cleaner stone and nice cracks above.
content.location: This is currently the first route you come to on the approach trail.  It sits up between two corners and has a lowering anchor visible from the ground.

content.description: Finger crack layback to a traverse under roof
content.location: Orange crack in left facing corner with small roof above

climbs.name: Claimjumper?
climbs.fa: Joel Tinl, Sam Lambie, J Foley

content.description: Good rock and easy start then crimpy at crux and slopes to anchor shared with gold pan.
content.location: Middle of three bolted routes on brown face that starts low angle and gets steeper at the top

content.description: Start in powerful layback or step in from the left. Tricky pro low, nice easy finish.
content.location: Crack just right of Miner's Lung arete. Anchor not visible from ground.

content.description: A thin face climb with the crux near the top.
content.protection: A fixed single bolt & carabiner directional and a tricky tension traverse allow you to set this up from the Butterscotch anchor.
content.location: Clean face left of Butterscotch Corner. This is currently the last completed route at Miner's.

content.description: Nice climbing in a corner up good stone.
content.location: This is currently the furthest route to the left. Look for a large hidden corner on the left end of this crag before the big bird poop pile. Starts on a loose ledge 15 feet left of the nice base of Blood Diamond. The anchors are not visible from the ground but you can see a bolt and biner on top of the smooth face to the left.

content.description: Starts with wide hand jams up to a large hollow block. Climb carefully over this into a short splitter hand crack in a corner this crack eventually trends right as the angle decreases and the rock quality declines.In the face to the left you can find some small pockets that will accept small C3's or TCU's for pro stay low and traverse left to share the last 8 feet of Blood Diamond.
content.location: Left around the corner from bolted route Miner Threat and right of thin corner crack that is Blood Diamond. A steep jagged splitter hand crack in black rock on a southeast face. Shares finish and anchor with Blood Diamond.

climbs.name: Barney Rubble
climbs.fa: Jay Foley, Tim Naylor, Joel Tinl and Mike Howard

content.description: Steep and pumpy flat crimp tugging leads to longer moves on bigger holds. Still a bit friable up until the solid finish.
content.location: On the left side of the southeast-facing corner that also holds Mr. Slate. Right of the loose and  chossy corner crack that is just right of Mother.

content.description: Start off stacked blocks and pull a V0 boulder problem to gain this easier trad lead. A bit of loose rock gives way to better rock and pro above.
content.location: Eight feet left of bolted route Mother.

content.description: Fun climbing up short hand crack on good rock
content.location: Start about twenty feet left of Diamond In The...and five feet right of Strike It...

content.description: Steep climbing up arete to a big move midway, then left onto a nice face. Finishes at ledge at base of overhanging headwall
content.location: This is the striking arete just left of Contributing To... and below the overhanging headwall.

content.description: Secluded Sport and Trad crack climbing on the West Side of the Rio Grande Gorge North of John Dunn Bridge. This is a "funky" area, some people have raved about the climbing here, while others have walked away without climbing. The cliff although very solid is scary looking with many fractures and sits above a rough dusty base.The climbing is well featured with lots of flat edges,crimps and cracks on mostly vertical to slightly overhanging basalt. The routes tend to be close together and short. Although a few sport routes are now 30 meters. The sport routes are well equipped and climb steep faces and aretes on solid rock. The trad routes follow cracks in faces and corners. Although there is typically ample pro the cracks can be jagged and be hollow or have some small loose rocks in the cracks. Expect tricky gear placements!
